When the Sevillano told the narrator that the task he was doing was "work for children", I infered that the Sevillano is a haughty, proud, and rude jerk who happens to be an amazing pearl diver. It is true that he has done many amazing things, but the fact that he has told these stories multiple times proves that he is too proud of the things he has done. He vividly explains how a burro clam clamped his arm, and how he found a great pearl. He continuously told the narrator of the dangers of pearl diving. He reminded him of the sharks, and the rope that he should not trip over. Overall, the Sevillano should certainly act more modest.
